Type.Name: ParamArrayAttribute

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ParamArrayAttribute extends System.Attribute

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Indicates that a method allows a variable number of arguments in its invocation.

remarks.para: This attribute can be applied to parameters. A parameter array allows the specification of an unknown number of arguments. The array is required to be a single-dimensional array that is the last parameter in a formal parameter list. It permits arguments to a method to be specified in two ways:

item.term: A single expression of a type that is implicitly convertible to the parameter array type. The array functions as a value parameter.
Zero or more arguments where each argument is an expression of a type that is implicitly convertible to the type of the parameter-array element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of the class.
